definition: towards/to face/to turn towards/direction/to support/to side with/shortly before/formerly/always/all along/(suffix) suitable for .../oriented to ...

sentences.english: The great ambition is spurring him on.
My aim is to becoming a good citizen so as to be able to render service to the (my) country.
sentences.chinese: 我的志向是做唯一好良民以便能給全國效力。

sentences.english: He who has no aspiration will be like a stray blindman.
sentences.chinese: 人無志向，像迷途的盲人一樣。

sentences.english: Those god-damned ambitions and the so-called believes .
sentences.chinese: 那些所謂的志向和信仰。

sentences.english: First, the mere idea of ambition in the factory was ludicrous.
sentences.chinese: 首先，在這樣的工廠裏提到遠大志向是可笑的。

sentences.english: Zhao Haochen was determined to become an English teacher when she enrolled at college.
sentences.chinese: 趙浩晨的大學志向就是當英語老師。

sentences.english: Jo's ambition was to do something very splendid.
sentences.chinese: 裘的志向是想轟轟烈烈地大幹一番。

sentences.english: A deep-rooted tree is leafy; an ambitious man is vigorous.
sentences.chinese: 根深的樹才能葉茂，有志向的人才會活力充沛。

sentences.english: I looksintosmine and see navel fluff, "said Barker, whose ambition is to collect enough navel pickings to stuff a pillow."
sentences.chinese: 他的志向是收集足夠的軟毛來填充一個枕頭。

sentences.english: I look into mine and see navel fluff, "said Barker, whose ambition is to collect enough navel pickings to stuff a pillow."
sentences.chinese: 他的志向是收集足夠的軟毛來填充一個枕頭。

sentences.english: B: We both have to overcome several obstacles if we are to achieve our ambitions.
sentences.chinese: 如果要實現我們的志向，我們都必須克服幾個障礙。

sentences.english: Now that you have high-minded ambition, I won't keep you strong.
sentences.chinese: 既然你有高潔的志向，我就不強留你了。

sentences.english: Thinking of his ambition, Han Xin swallowed the insult and crawled between the rascal's legs.
sentences.chinese: 向到自己的遠大志向，韓信忍辱爬了過去。

sentences.english: Everybody has his own ambition, try an all-out effort to fight.
sentences.chinese: 每個人都有自己的志向，好好努力奮鬥。

sentences.english: A: That’s why ambition need to be realistic.
sentences.chinese: 這就是爲什麼志向需要是現實的。

sentences.english: In Marilyn’s America, there were aspirations.
sentences.chinese: 夢露時代的美國，有着高遠的志向。

definition: one's bosom (the seat of emotions)/breast/broad-minded and open/to think about/to cherish
to dedicate oneself to the service of one's country
to stand out among one's peers (idiom)/to excel
